scripts.say: After we had our lunch, I instructed Newcastle to take an hour off. ...And she was gone in the blink of an eye.
Even though lunch wasn't quite over yet, I was a bit curious as to what she did during her spare time, so I decided to look for her.
Do you need something? You're looking for Newcastle?
Erm... Sorry, but little old Kent hasn't seen anything...
Huh...? That cloud over there looks like... Gah! I wasn't daydreaming! I swear, I was working!
...Umm, where did Newcastle go? I don't know either...
Newcastle? If she's not with Sheffield, then she's probably somewhere reading by herself!
Anyway, I don't know where she is... but she has been helping out with maid duties, so I'd guess maybe she's off doing something like that?
Why not try looking in that empty lot behind the Royal Navy's dorms? That's where we usually dry out the laundry...
Finally, I found her in the lot Edinburgh mentioned, hidden behind a white sheet that was fluttering in the wind.
She was sitting on a stool next to the clothes rack with a half-opened book in her lap, drowsiness weighing upon her eyelids.
As if she sensed me approaching, she raised her head serenely, a gentle smile forming upon her lips.
